title: Genital Warts
content:
Okay. Now that I’ve got your attention...

I recently saw an ad with this great typeface that I wonder if anyone can i.d. for me. below are lots of examples.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705164433im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/g1_5017.png)
  
(I love the innuendo of that one!)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705164433im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/g2_4930.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705164433im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/g3_5215.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705164433im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/g4_4170.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705164433im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/g5_3479.png)

In the print ad, I could see that the face has rough edges (not so easy to see at 72ppi). I’m much more interested in the letterforms themselves, so if anyone knows comparable faces without the rough edges, please advise.

Thanks.

 [‹ (x) Upright italic 'f' - various {gang}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705164433/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43616 "Go to previous forum topic") [Varig ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705164433/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43720 "Go to next forum topic")
author: microspective

comments.content: Would that be Block Berthold Condensed?

It’s Block Berthold Condensed.

And thanks for sharing...

Hi Raymond,  
that’s the notorious [Block Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705164433/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/block-be/). And: you really don’t need misleading thread titles to attract attention on this board.  
F

edit: Now I see the ‘warts’ are part of the text – so, they’re not 100% OT. Sorry, didn’t read, just looked at the letters.

And for a similar but clean look, try [Roger Excoffon](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705164433/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Roger%252BExcoffon)’s [Antique Olive](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705164433/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/antique-olive/t-bold-condensed/): it also has short descenders, a straight ‘R’ leg, narrow ‘c’, double-storey ‘a’ and single-storey ‘g’.

You might also like [Hermes](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705164433/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontfeed/archives/in-use-hermes-for-wig-01/), another typeface inspired by [Heinz Hoffmann](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705164433/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/designer/h_hoffmann/).

Thanks, everyone! And thank you, Florian, for your honest catch!

For some reason, Antique Olive has never appealed to me. I think it’s the comparatively light joining of the bowls to stems, and the like. Granted, this is one of the defining characteristics...

Hermes is pretty hot. I wish the heavier weights didn’t have as much stroke contrast, but that Thin weight is nice!
